Package importedImplementations.SanguptaBloom.bloomfilter

Interface BloomFilter<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be stored in the filter
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBloomFilter, DelegatingBloomFilter, InMemoryBloomFilter
public interface BloomFilter<T>
A simple bloom filter contract for everyone. Cheat sheet: m: total bits n: expected insertions k: number of hashes per element b: m/n, bits per insertion p: expected false positive probability 1) Optimal k = b * ln2 2) p = (1 - e ^ (-kn/m))^k 3) For optimal k: p = 2 ^ (-k) ~= 0.6185^b 4) For optimal k: m = -nlnp / ((ln2) ^ 2)
Since:
1.0
Author:
sangupta

      Returns:

      boolean contains(byte[] bytes)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the bloom filter indicates the presence of entry, false otherwise

    • contains

      Check if the value object is present in the bloom filter or not by decomposing it using the given/default decomposer

      value - the object to be tested for existence in bloom filter
      Returns:

    • containsAll

      boolean containsAll(Collection<T> values)
      Check if all the values represented as a collection of objects are present in the bloom filter or not.
      Parameters:
      values - the Collection of values to be tested for existence in bloom filter
      Returns:
      true if the bloom filter indicates that all values are present in the filter, false otherwise
